de.bkroeger.myvisio.svg

Class SVGTransformImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bkroeger.myvisio.svg.SVGTransformImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, SVGTransform

    public class SVGTransformImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements SVGTransform, java.io.Serializable
    Many of SVG's graphics operations utilize 2x3 matrices of the form: [a c e] [b d f] which, when expanded into a 3x3 matrix for the purposes of matrix arithmetic, become: [a c e] [b d f] [0 0 1]
    Author:
    bk
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      void setMatrix(SVGMatrix matrix) 
      void setRotate(float angle, float cx, float cy)
      Rotation about the origin is equivalent to the matrix or [cos(a) sin(a) -sin(a) cos(a) 0 0], which has the effect of rotating the coordinate system axes by angle a.
      void setScale(float sx, float sy)
      Scaling is equivalent to the matrix or [sx 0 0 sy 0 0].
      void setSkewX(float angle)
      A skew transformation along the x-axis is equivalent to the matrix or [1 0 tan(a) 1 0 0], which has the effect of skewing X coordinates by angle a.
      void setSkewY(float angle)
      A skew transformation along the y-axis is equivalent to the matrix or [1 tan(a) 0 1 0 0], which has the effect of skewing Y coordinates by angle a.
      void setTranslate(float tx, float ty)
      Translation is equivalent to the matrix or [1 0 0 1 tx ty], where tx and ty are the distances to translate coordinates in X and Y, respectively.

      • setTranslate

        public void setTranslate(float tx,
                         float ty)
        Translation is equivalent to the matrix or [1 0 0 1 tx ty], where tx and ty are the distances to translate coordinates in X and Y, respectively.
        Specified by:
        setTranslate in interface SVGTransform
        Parameters:
        tx - - translate x
        ty - - translate y

      • setScale

        public void setScale(float sx,
                     float sy)
        Scaling is equivalent to the matrix or [sx 0 0 sy 0 0]. One unit in the X and Y directions in the new coordinate system equals sx and sy units in the previous coordinate system, respectively.
        Specified by:
        setScale in interface SVGTransform
        Parameters:
        sx - - Scaling x
        sy - - Scaling y

      • setRotate

        public void setRotate(float angle,
                      float cx,
                      float cy)
        Rotation about the origin is equivalent to the matrix or [cos(a) sin(a) -sin(a) cos(a) 0 0], which has the effect of rotating the coordinate system axes by angle a.
        Specified by:
        setRotate in interface SVGTransform
        Parameters:
        angle - - Winkel
        cx - - center x
        cy - - center y
